sub_topic: The self-similarity of the Barnsley fern.
message_1: What is the scaling factor of the Barnsley fern if the first stem is 1 unit in length and the largest fronds are 1/3 unit in length?
message_2:
The scaling factor of the Barnsley fern can be found by dividing the length of the largest fronds by the length of the first stem. In this case, the largest fronds are 1/3 unit in length, and the first stem is 1 unit in length.

Scaling factor = (Length of largest fronds) / (Length of first stem)
Scaling factor = (1/3) / 1
Scaling factor = 1/3

So, the scaling factor of the Barnsley fern in this case is 1/3.
